author: mratsim
content:
can you run constantine benches on the same machine?

```
git clone https://github.com/mratsim/constantine
cd constantine
CC=clang nimble bench_eth_evm_precompiles
```

author: mratsim
content: (assuming nim v2.0,8 and Clang are installed)

author: chfast
content: This is quite bad machine for benchmarks ðŸ™‚ But I'll try tomorrow

author: mratsim
content: due to the 3 types of cores?

author: chfast
content: I pin the benchmark to a performance core, but I also need to down-clock it from 4.5 to 4.0 GHz to keep the temperature stable.

author: chfast
content: The evmmax is somehow PoC. No assembly, keep it simple. although there are some improvements in the pipeline.

author: chfast
content: Specifically, we generated the field inversion using addchain tools, but it is relatively slow. libff in this context is using GMP.

author: chfast
content: On the flip side there are high-level optimization missing in libff. They make pairings 2-4x faster than libff even without assembly.
